meta.title: New Zealand recreational fish length–weight coefficients
meta.region: New Zealand (preferred where available); some highly migratory species use best-available SW Pacific / WCPO coefficients noted in records.
notes: Ensure the input length type matches the coefficient record (e.g., FL vs LJFL).
Coefficients are population averages; individual condition can vary.

source.citation: Walsh et al. (2003) as reported in NIWA/MPI documentation (both sexes combined).

app_notes: Use fork length (snout to tail fork).
Use fork length (snout to tail fork).

source.citation: Paul (1976) length–weight relationship (originally weight in grams; converted here to kg).
source.evidence_note: NZ/Australasian reference commonly used in NZ fisheries contexts.

app_notes: Use fork length; confirm your UI guidance uses FL not total length.

source.citation: HAP 1 stock parameters (regional); compiled in NIWA/MPI assessment tables.
source.evidence_note: NZ stock-specific estimate; multiple regional variants exist.

app_notes: Groper in NZ commonly refers to Hāpuku and Bass; ensure correct species selection.
Consider adding regional variants later if you need finer accuracy (e.g., HAP 7).

variants.label: Example alternate regional estimate (range indicator)
variants.notes: Illustrative alternative within reported regional ranges; use if you store a coefficient set per stock.

source.type: Scientific report / thesis used in NZ assessments
source.citation: Johnston (1993) as reported in NIWA/MPI groper assessment tables.
source.evidence_note: NZ reference for bass; robust-bodied compared with Hāpuku.

app_notes: Use fork length; expect heavier fish for a given length than Hāpuku.

source.type: WCPO / SW Pacific study (best-available for NZ rec use)
source.citation: Regional WCPFC-area study (example: large sample from WCPO).
source.evidence_note: Highly migratory; NZ-specific coefficients may be sparse—treat as best-available proxy and label accordingly.

app_notes: Use fork length; consider later replacing with NZ observer-based coefficients if available.

source.citation: NZ observer data analysis (1987–2000), reported as ln(W)=3.02 ln(L) - 10.93 (W in kg, L in cm).
source.evidence_note: Converted to a-form for application use.

source.citation: James (1984), TRE 1 stock (originally weight in grams; converted here to kg).

source.type: SW Pacific / regional study (proxy for NZ rec use)
source.citation: Southwest Pacific dataset (example: large regional sample); coefficients for LJFL.
source.evidence_note: Highly migratory; use as best-available regional proxy unless NZ-specific becomes available.

app_notes: Length is Lower Jaw–Fork Length (LJFL). Ensure your measurement instructions are explicit.

source.citation: NZ recreational data (n≈684) length–weight relationship using (curved) LJFL.
source.evidence_note: NZ-specific relationship; confirm whether your LJFL is measured straight or curved.

app_notes: If your app uses straight LJFL, consider applying a conversion or sourcing straight-length coefficients.
Sex differences not significant in the referenced NZ dataset.
